Assembly Publicization

I find the best way to publicize Valheim assemblies is to do it directly on referencing it from the Valheim directory. This means it'll dynamically publicize whatever is in the Valheim install folder and it's overall less to manage.

To do this, I recommend the BepInEx.AssemblyPublicizer.MSBuild nuget package. Then when you preference the DLL, use Publicize="true". Here's a full example:

    <Reference Include="assembly_valheim" Publicize="true">
      <HintPath>..\..\..\.local\share\Steam\steamapps\common\Valheim\valheim_Data\Managed\assembly_valheim.dll</HintPath>
    </Reference>

Full Example

Here's a full example of the CWJesse.BetterFPS.csproj.user file with this working to dynamically reference and publicize the Valheim assembly. I chose this file as an example because it's smaller than in my projects.

CWJesse.BetterFPS.csproj.user net472 disable disable 0.0.0 .......local\share\Steam\steamapps\common\Valheim\BepInEx\core\0Harmony.dll .......local\share\Steam\steamapps\common\Valheim\valheim_Data\Managed\assembly_valheim.dll .......local\share\Steam\steamapps\common\Valheim\BepInEx\core\BepInEx.dll .......local\share\Steam\steamapps\common\Valheim\valheim_Data\Managed\UnityEngine.dll .......local\share\Steam\steamapps\common\Valheim\valheim_Data\Managed\UnityEngine.AnimationModule.dll .......local\share\Steam\steamapps\common\Valheim\valheim_Data\Managed\UnityEngine.CoreModule.dll all runtime; build; native; contentfiles; analyzers; buildtransitive
